sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is a family-owned and operated full-service fabrication and installation company servicing NWA that specializes in residential/commercial: quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: Job Numbers In Northwest Arkansas Hold Strong
posts.content:
Arkansas saw an increase of 15,873 job gains over the last year, with Northwest Arkansas accounting for nearly 25% of the year-over-year growth.

  • Now hiring: As the state’s second-largest metro area, NWA saw an estimated 288,680 jobs in December 2022, up 3,944 from the previous year.
  • Steady numbers: The region’s jobless rate was 2% last December, slightly increasing from 1.9% in 2021. The national unemployment rate in December was 3.3%.

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Art Opportunities For Kids Across NWA
posts.content:
Opportunities for kids to explore the arts are beginning across Northwest Arkansas this week, with some offering spring break camps.

  • Taking the stage: Various classes and camps for youth interested in acting are available at Trike Theatre in Bentonville and at Arts Live Theatre and TheatreSquared in Fayetteville.
  • Create: Explore kids' art classes and spring break art camps at Crystal Bridges, the Amazeum, the Fayetteville Public Library, and the Community Creative Center.

Find more opportunities HERE.

posts.title: Rogers Public Library Hosts Author Panel and Book Reading
posts.content:
Recognizing the importance of representation in children's literature, Rogers Public Library will host the fourth annual We Write For You, a Black children's book author and illustrator panel and reading, on Saturday, Feb 11, at 2p.

  • Introducing: Hosted by the Phi Alpha Omega Chapter of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc. and the Tea Rose Foundation of NWA, this year's panel includes four award-winning national authors and illustrators: Ashley Franklin, Vashti Harrison, Rafael Lopez, and Rita Williams-Garcia.
  • Take it home: Food and drinks will be provided for all attendees, and children ages 0-17 will receive free books.

Learn more and register for the event HERE.

posts.title: Daisy Airgun Museum Releases Custom 2023 Model
posts.content:
Daisy Airgun Museum in Downtown Rogers preserves and promotes vintage products and artifacts of the historic Daisy company and draws Daisy fans and collectors from all over to the region.

  • History: Every year, Daisy Museum runs a limited edition of the classic Daisy Model 25 pump-action BB gun with custom artwork engraved on the stock to honor a historic site. The 2023 edition highlights the Ozark Cider & Vinegar Co., paying homage to the once-thriving apple and vinegar industry of Benton County.
  • It's a Daisy: Visit the Daisy Airgun Museum to learn more about the manufacturer's history in Rogers and take a picture with the World's Largest Dasiy BB Gun.

Read more about Daisy HERE.

posts.title: NWA Daily is Giving Away 2 Tickets to Taylor Swift in Dallas
posts.content:
You read that correctly - NWA Daily is giving away TWO tickets to see T-Swift live in Dallas.

  • You belong with me: For all you Swifty fans, listen up! We are giving away two concert tickets to see Taylor Swift live in concert at Dallas Cowboy Stadium on April 1 ($1,500 value).
  • Here is how to enter: 1) You must be subscribed to NWA Daily's newsletter (hint: if you're reading this email, you are a subscriber; 2) You must tag who you would take to the concert or just another friend from Northwest Arkansas who might also want a chance to win on our IG page; and 3) You get a bonus entry if you share the post on your IG story and tag @nwa.daily so we see it.

Find out more about this incredible giveaway HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Diamond: The Arkansas Department of Health awarded Washington Regional a Diamond Award for its excellent care of stroke patients.
  • Starships: A bright meteor lit the sky green over Arkansas on Monday night around 7p.
  • Lighting bolt: Cross Country Runner Haley Loewe joins the ranks of over a dozen athletes from Bentonville Schools to be named Gatorade Players of the Year.
  • Before Yellowstone: Wes Bentley, a star in the hit show Yellowstone, began his acting career in an Arkansas drama classroom.
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
